name: Letter from Lipsius, Justus to Clusius, Carolus, 1591-06-23

Diplomatic.text:
<body>I[ustus] Lipsius Car[olo] Clusio S[alutem] D[icit].
 Imo bono consilio, Clusi, (<ab id="9026055"/>ne omen hoc mihi vitupera<ae id="9026055"/>) Spadanas aquas venimus, quae iamnunc incipiunt refovere nos et exhibere se salutares. De exitu tamen nihil promitto: in Dei manu est, medici unici et supremi, sine quo auxilium omne infirmum. Mihi sedet in his vicinisque locis diutius haerere, nec temere ad Batavos redire ob caussas quas probas probis futuras spero, et satis tamen est si mihi. Nam exterior haec vita nihil est, quod ad aliorum nutum dirigatur: semi-liberi saltem sumus nec obnoxium aut devinctum me censeo cuiquam. Interior autem illa uni Iudici si proba, quem timemus? Hoc scribo, mi Clusi, quia varia iudicia sive voces futuras de secessu hoc nostro et diu obfirmato consilio, non sum ignarus, sed contemno et mihi uni rationem hanc duco. Tu ut me ames, cupio, ego te, uti semper. Flores <ab id="9026056"/>Tuliparum<ae id="9026056"/> perelegantes habui et misit ad me expressas imagines <ab id="9026057"/>uxor.<ae id="9026057"/> Haec post studia altera mea vita et cura. Nobiles Gallos, nominatim <ab id="9026069"/>Pellissonium<ae id="9026069"/> et <ab id="9026070"/>Morlassium<ae id="9026070"/>, si illic sunt, amice saluta, etiam <ab id="9026071"/>Colvium<ae id="9026071"/>, quem miror gravatum verbulo me compellare. Aquis Spadanis VIIII Kal[endas] Iul[ias] M.D.XCI.</body>

annotations.text: Pellissonium: Pierre Pélisson, a confirmed Protestant, was councellor and master of requests of the king of Navarra from 16 February 1582 on. He had married Jeanne du Bourg and is author of a pamphlet, Propositions du sieur Du Perron, évêque d’Evreux sur les marques et authorités de l’Eglise etc. avec la réponse du sieur Pélisson, conseiller du roy et maître des requêtes de l’hotel de Navarre (Sedan, 1617). Cf. Haag, La France protestante, 8, 170-171.

annotations.text: Morlassium: Jean de Morlas († Mâcon, 27 August 1595) was the natural son of Salettes, president of the parliament of Pau. From 1589 on, he became one of the most active agents of Henry of Navarra, whom he strongly urged to convert to Catholicism, as he did himself. Navarra appointed him member of his Private Council and of the State Council. Cf. Haag, 7, 509-510.
